intro: Cullumia selago, commonly known as the silverleaf cullumia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in the spring. Cullumia selago is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
